intro: Linociera caudata, commonly known as the hairy antelope's foot, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Linociera caudata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
